title: 'Famous Handwritings'
content:
Dear fellow Typophiles,

I am currently looking for samples of 'famous' [handwriting](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022064409/http:/typophile.com/wiki/handwriting) scripts. I am especially interested in samples of Blaise Pascal's handwriting. Anyone of you ever 'searched' for / noticed / found such samples, sources and lettering excerpts? _(Please note, I am not necessarily looking for actual typefaces, based on famous handwriting. But I am of course open and thankful for any suggestions and hints.)_

Thank you.

Dav
author: Dav

comments.content:
Dav,

[P22.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022064409/http:/www.p22.com/products/index.html) have script typefaces based upon the handwriting samples of Cezanne, Van Gogh and da Vinci.
ParaType has [Pushkin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022064409/http:/www.paratype.com/pstore/fonts/pushkin.htm), based on the handwriting of the great Russian poet, in both Latin and Cyrillic.

You could order a reproduction at the National Library in Paris — [http://tinyurl.com/yaas78](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022064409/http:/tinyurl.com/yaas78 "http://tinyurl.com/yaas78") — they keep the manuscripts of “Pensees”: [http://tinyurl.com/ygyyyc](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022064409/http:/tinyurl.com/ygyyyc "http://tinyurl.com/ygyyyc")

[http://www.bl.uk/onlinegallery/ttp/ttpbooks.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022064409/http:/www.bl.uk/onlinegallery/ttp/ttpbooks.html "http://www.bl.uk/onlinegallery/ttp/ttpbooks.html")

There are a variety of handwriting samples from Jane Austen to Mozart here, nothing by Pascal though.  
Tim
